sentences.en: An entire poor section of town was bombed into oblivion.
sentences.cn: 城市的一整片贫民区被炸为了平地。

sentences.en: Beholding, besides love, the end of love, / Hearing oblivion beyond memory!
sentences.cn: 我看见了爱, 还看到了爱的结局, /听到了记忆外层的哪一片寂寥!

sentences.en: He consigned all the unpleasant thoughts to oblivion.
sentences.cn: 他把一切不愉快的思想置于脑后.

sentences.en: He just drank himself into oblivion.
He often drinks himself into oblivion.
sentences.cn: 他常常喝酒喝得不省人事。

sentences.en: His work fell / sank into oblivion after his death.
sentences.cn: 他死后,他的作品便被淡忘了.
我又什么都感觉不到了.

sentences.en: It seems that the so-called new theory is likely to sink into oblivion.
sentences.cn: 这所谓的新理论看来将很可能被人淡忘。

sentences.en: Many ancient cities have long since passed into oblivion.
sentences.cn: 许多古代的城市早已湮没.

sentences.en: Many subject engaged the attention of the best mathematicians ultimately faded into oblivion.
sentences.cn: 许多科目得到最好的数学家的注意,但终于湮没无闻.

sentences.en: She was herself returning home to seek rest and oblivion among her kins fold.
sentences.cn: 她正在回国途中,打算在自己的亲属中找到安宁,忘却过去.

sentences.en: Some poems are doomed to oblivion.
sentences.cn: 有些诗注定会被湮灭遗忘.

sentences.en: The city has long since passed into oblivion.
The loser’s name has been consigned to oblivion (= completely forgotten ).
sentences.cn: 失败者的姓名已湮没无闻。

sentences.en: Tom appeared from his oblivion as we were sitting down to supper together.
sentences.cn: 我们正在一起坐下来吃晚饭时,汤姆又从默默无闻中出现了.

sentences.en: Within the hour he had slipped once again into deep and dreamless oblivion.
sentences.cn: 不出一小时，他再次陷入了无梦的沉睡。

words.tran_cn: 遗忘的；健忘的；不注意的；不知道的

trans.tran_en: when something is completely forgotten or no longer important
